恐怖的“双枪射手”制霸亚平宁！C罗的金靴不稳了

AC米兰本轮对阵恩波利，“双枪射手”皮亚特克连续第5场比赛为红黑军团进球，他再一次追平了队史功勋纪录。

米兰的冬季新援皮亚特克本轮不负众望地再次取得进球。在对阵恩波利的下半场比赛开踢仅4分钟，皮亚特克就接到恰尔汗奥卢的助攻推射破门，为米兰拉开了胜利的序幕。进球后波兰小子又做出了自己标志性的“打手枪”庆祝动作，如今这已然是米兰球迷最熟悉的一幕。

皮亚特克自第一次代表米兰首发取得进球之后就场场首发，场场进球，在联赛中连续4场首发都有进球的他追平了米兰功勋球员比埃尔霍夫的进球，他在1998-99赛季加盟米兰后，在代表红黑军团在前4场首发比赛全部取得进球。

本场比赛的进球是他连续5场各项赛事为米兰取得进球，也是他身披红黑战袍打进的第7粒进球。除去首秀仅出场18分钟不谈，皮亚特克4轮联赛出场289分钟就打进了5球，平均每57.8分钟就进一球的效率完全碾压了自己的队友。

此外放眼欧洲五大联赛，本赛季到目前为止进球效率高过皮亚特克的也只有巴萨之王梅西。皮亚特克在27场各项赛事中打进了26球，梅西则在31场各项比赛中打进30球。进球数据排在两者身后的是巴黎圣日耳曼的姆巴佩，他在30场比赛中打进了25球；莱万多夫斯基同样拥有25粒进球，但他用了31场比赛。阿圭罗则是31场比赛取得了24粒进球。

得益于皮亚特克的稳定发挥，米兰自2012年12月以来首次在联赛中连续3场比赛都有3球进账；而这3场比赛米兰都最终取得了胜利，关键的12分帮助米兰牢牢锁住联赛第4的位置，并且在本轮先赛一场的情况下距离排名第3的国米仅落后1分，这让红黑军团本赛季有望去争夺联赛第3。

目前皮亚特克凭借这轮的进球继续巩固了射手榜上的位置，18粒进球让他领先身后夸利亚雷拉以及杜万-萨帕塔2球，并让他距离排名第1的C罗仅差1球，波兰人随时都有可能赶超尤文的当家巨星。

加盟米兰时皮亚特克曾希望能够得到9号战袍，但莱昂纳多透露高层认为波兰人需要用表现来争取这个号码，因此给了他19号。从双枪射手目前6场7球的效率来看，他比米兰近年来的不少9号球员都配得上这个号码，如果能够一直保持这样的状态并把红黑军团带回欧冠赛场的话，下赛季皮亚特克定能得到他心仪的9号战袍。

加盟米兰时皮亚特克曾希望能够得到9号战袍，但莱昂纳多透露高层认为波兰人需要用表现来争取这个号码，因此给了他19号。从双枪射手目前6场7球的效率来看，他比米兰近年来的不少9号球员都配得上这个号码，如果能够一直保持这样的状态并把红黑军团带回欧冠赛场的话，下赛季皮亚特克定能得到他心仪的9号战袍。

The Coach spoke at a Press conference after Friday evening’s 3-0 victory over Empoli, a result that put them within a point of third-placed Inter, awaiting the Nerazzurri’s trip to Fiorentina.

When asked if the Rossoneri were setting their sights firmly on third, Gattuso called the question “laughable. We’re not even thinking about Inter.

“I would gladly take the deal if you told me Inter would finish third and Milan fourth. I’d take that deal with a signature as big as San Siro.”

The top four go into the Champions League group phase next season, so third or fourth would make little difference to the city rivals.

Milan certainly seem to have the momentum and a lot of that is down to Piatek, who has scored seven goals in his last five games between Serie A and the Coppa Italia.

“Piatek has settled in very well and works hard, but he’s not a player who stands out in training. He looks after himself, but doesn’t do that much. He is far more practical, focuses on the important things and likes to test out the movements two or three days before a game.

“Piatek is very interested in research and comes to ask the staff about the characteristics of the opposition defenders.”

Full-back Andrea Conti had his first start since August 2017, having finally shaken off those knee injuries, and provided an assist in the 3-0 win over Empoli.

“Don’t forget the club paid €25m for him before the injury and he is slowly getting back to his best. He is Milan’s heritage, but can improve a great deal in his defending.”

Patrick Cutrone’s agent has refused to confirm the striker’s future lies at Milan but says fellow client Simone Verdi ‘has only shown half of his worth’ at Napoli.

Krzysztof Piatek’s arrival at Milan has limited Cutrone to substitute appearances at San Siro, and Donato Orgnoni admitted the Italy starlet would be forced to consider his future if his situation did not improve.

“Will Cutrone stay at Milan? We’ll see,” he told Radio Marte.

He added to Milan News: “Cutrone is a player who wants to play and has always accepted the Coach’s decisions.

“It’s normal that, should his space in the team be extremely reduced between now and the end of the season, we’ll weigh up what the best solution is for the lad and Milan in the summer.”

Manuel Locatelli has explained why he left Milan for Sassuolo. “I seemed like the new Messi, then there was the criticism…”

Locatelli appeared destined for a long career with Milan after a breakthrough 2016-17 campaign, but the Italy Under-21 midfielder moved to Sassuolo last summer.

“I scored my first Serie A goal at Sassuolo,” the 21-year-old told Inside Serie A.

“To score a goal at San Siro and crown that comeback was something unique. I was probably destined to come here.

“Incidentally, I chose the No 73 and I scored my first Serie A goal in the 73rd minute: if that isn’t destiny.

“I had some good times at Milan. I seemed like the new Messi: front pages, articles, TV, lots of attention…

“Then there was the criticism, a lot of it when things didn’t go well. It hurt me, I admit I suffered and then I had some bad times.

“Thanks to the help of my family and girlfriend, I managed to overcome them. Sassuolo also believed in me.”

Locatelli is arguably best known for his long-range winner against Juventus in October 2016…

“It changed my life,” he confessed.

“People, when they stop me on the street, still remind me of that goal. When I think of that goal against Juve, in front of 70,000 people, to win 1-0 and score against Buffon, it still gives me goosebumps.”
